intro: Pakau, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the genus Phormium and is characterized by its tall, sword-shaped leaves that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant is adapted to coastal and forest environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are used traditionally by Māori for weaving baskets, mats, and other crafts. Pakau also produces small, greenish flowers that bloom in clusters at the base of the plant.
